author: The Acorn Staff
title: AT THE LIBRARY
text:
The library’s Winter Pumpkin Patch Story Time runs from Jan. 9 through Feb. 13. On Thursdays, Lap Sit for ages up to 24 months is at 10:30 a.m. Toddler story time for ages 2 to 4 years will be at 11 a.m.
Story times will be held in the library’s multipurpose room. Go to the front of the library and follow signs.
Paws to Read will be from 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. on Sat., Jan. 11. Children grades K through 4 can read to a Pet Partner therapy dog for 15 minutes. Reservations are required on the Library website.
The Wednesday Morning Book Club will be at 11 a.m. Jan. 15. For more information and the title of the book, email Karilyn Steward at .
At 6 p.m. on Wed., Jan. 15 the Online Film Fanatics will meet on Zoom for an informal discussion of a film. For more information, the title of the film and the Zoom meeting link, please email .
The Tuesday Evening Book Club for adults will be at 5:30 p.m. on Jan. 21. For more information and the title of the book, email Barbara Lockwood at .
Study Buddies tutoring will be held by appointment on Zoom at 4 p.m. Tues., Jan. 28. Sign up is required on the Library website. Tutoring is done by Advanced Placement and Honors High School students. Email for more information.
On Tues., Jan. 28 join staff for a genealogy workshop on Zoom at 6 p.m. Be a part of an interactive event where you’ll explore technology to enhance your family history research and discover creative solutions for displaying your ancestors’ photographs. Email for the Zoom link.
The Friends of the Library is having a meeting at 6 p.m. Wed., Jan. 8 on Zoom. For more information and to obtain the Zoom link email .
The Library is closed on Jan. 18, 19 and 23. It will close at 5 p.m. on Thursdays, Jan. 2, 9, 16 and 30.
For more information, contact the Calabasas Library at (818) 225-7616 or check the website at http://www.calabasaslibrary.org.
